entry.title: Revert "[//gpu] Move WGPU texture creation to helper in IOSurfaceImageBacking"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 088464038ece655c0a0abab2820f3bc90d87a270.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/compile-analysis/b/8756561814083013121



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756561814083013121



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5272316&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Fcompile-analysis%2Fb%2F8756561814083013121&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> [//gpu] Move WGPU texture creation to helper in IOSurfaceImageBacking

>

> Preparatory CL for conditionally caching the WGPU texture in the

> backing - moving all this goop out of BeginAccess() will make the

> flow wrt using the cached texture vs. creating the texture in that

> function more clear.

>

entry.title: Fix autofill shared storage encoding and add browsertest
entry.content:
This fixes a bug in converting the encoded autofill shared storage data

from the proto-serialized std::string into a std::u16string. Using

base::UTF8ToUTF16 directly incorrectly converts the byte string as a

character string. This is fixed by first converting the string to a

base64 encoded format.



Added browsertest coverage that caught and tests this conversion.

entry.title: Remove spurious differences in tests for different usage
entry.content:
These tests each assert that changing _one_ argument to `QSR::Request` resulted in requests that could not be pooled. But both tests were actually changing _two_ arguments. The ProxyChain test was furthermore

passing the same chain (the invalid chain) to both.



Happily, it turns out the functionality they were testing was correct.

entry.title: [Printing] Enrich CupsPrintingNotification for Web Printing API jobs
entry.content:
Jobs initiated by Isolated Web Apps (IWAs) via the Web Printing API do

not require a print dialog which allows these apps to print silently.

To keep the user aware of what is actually happening, it's necessary to

augment the existing printing notification with a few important details:

* The name of the initiating IWA;

* An option to revoke the IWA's permission to print.



To achieve the latter while preserving the existing behavior (open the

print management app on click), the notification is now equipped with

two buttons: one brings the user to the content settings page, and the

other opens the print management app as before.



Note that these changes only apply to jobs submitted via the Web

Printing API; for all others notifications follow the existing model.



On top of that, a few messages are updated to align with the modern

UX guidance:

* Printing started -> Printing...

* Printing complete -> Done



See go/advanced-printer-features-wd for details on wordsmithing.



Bug: b/302505962

Change-Id: Ie2c62ae1f9c271070a352a0d4f11cc5a00f7cafa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224206

entry.content:

state. The pref is already used for signed in non-syncing users in

crrev.com/c/5237310.

Usage of the pref is gated by kSyncRememberCustomPassphraseAfterSignout.

The main reason to include syncing users it to simplify the migration.



This CL also updates ClearEncryptionBootstrapToken to clear the new

pref completely for syncing users, to match the existing behaviour of

the old pref, which is cleared on signout.

entry.title: Fix external app cross window navigation
entry.content:
This CL fixes the way external app are opened using

another window



1. disallow cross origin/cross window request.

Cross origin cross window request would lead to the app

opening prompt being displayed on tab A while the request

really comes from tab B, which can lead to user confusion.

Disallow it. There is a chance that this may break some

legitimate flows, so add a kill switch in case this must

be temporarily disabled



2. fix the "transient tab" logic.

There is a logic in which a tab can be used to open an

external application, and then is immediately closed.

The current logic close the target tab and reattributes

the popup to the initiating tab.

This is not working as the closed tab also dealloced

the tabhelper, and so the popup has no handler anymore.

Fix this logic by delaying the tab closing until after

the popup is resolved.





Bug: 1522922

Change-Id: I53e5f58204039636b79cc7abae570c998d55acb0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5249934

entry.title: [Demo Mode] Fix Store Number Help Text to Turn Red
entry.content:
Make the id attribute store-number-input-invalid separate by dashes.



Attribute names with dashes are converted to camelCase property names

by capitalizing the character following each dash, then removing the

dashes, and vice versa. Therefore, the property storeNumberInputInvalid

in .ts is converted to store-number-input-invalid in .html.



We can refer to this Polymer library doc https://polymer-library.polymer-project.org/1.0/docs/devguide/properties#property-name-mapping

entry.title: Rename {absl => std}::optional in //ui/
entry.content:
#cleanup



Automated patch. This is a no-op. Please avoid, as much as possible,

assigning unrelated bugs to this.



Context:

--------

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/nBD_1LaanTc/m/ghh-ZZhWAwAJ?utm_medium=email

As of https://crrev.com/1204351, absl::optional is now a type alias

for std::optional. We should migrate toward it.



This patch:

----------

This applies the rename to ui/



Script:

-------

````

cd ui

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}

replace "absl::make_optional" "std::make_optional"

replace "absl::optional" "std::optional"

replace "absl::nullopt" "std::nullopt"

replace "absl::in_place," "std::in_place,"

replace "absl::in_place_t," "std::in_place_t,"

replace "\"third_party\/abseil-cpp\/absl\/types\/optional.h\"" ""

cd ..



git status

echo "Formatting"



echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git cl format

git restore ".clang-format"

```



# Skipping win-presubmit, due to a bug in depot_tools:

# See https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/324293047

NOPRESUBMIT=true



CQ_INCLUDE_TRYBOTS=luci.chrome.try:chromeos-betty-pi-arc-chrome



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Cleanup: This is a cleanup.

Bug: chromium:1500249

Change-Id: I134bbce97a0ae63ae432a5733e934828f8f49c77

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5279376

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

Auto-Submit: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

entry.title: Fix passing component policy from Ash to Lacros
entry.content:
Component policy (i.e. policy for extensions) should be passed to

Lacros at first launch. This is currently not happening because at the

time of initializing launch parameters for Lacros, component policy is

not set in EnvironmentProvider yet. This is because BrowserManager

starts observing ComponentPolicyService then continues on to

initializing Lacros launch parameters, while the notification from

ComponentPolicyService happens asynchronously.

This CL fixes this issue by caching the component policy in

ComponentPolicyService and fetching it synchronously when preparing

policies for Lacros, in addition to observing changes in the policy.



Bug: b/40912274

Change-Id: I296a5c4b3fb5aeeedf658ead0b80102d8b77796b

entry.title: Rename //net/base/mac directory to //net/base/apple (5/5)
entry.content:
This renames the remaining directory in //net/base used both by macOS

and iOS, following the naming convention and changing it something more

suggestive.



Like suggested by mark@, this renaming process will be carried on in

three steps:



1. Rename net/base/mac to net/base/apple, creating new temporary

forwarding headers in net/base/mac that #include net/base/apple.



2. Convert all of the use sites from net/base/mac to net/base/apple.

This can be done across multiple ch anges if desirable, which could make

things more manageable for reviewers.



3. Remove the temporary forwarding headers in net/base/mac, so that

we’re only left with net/base/apple. The changes here are performing

this step, which is the final of this series.



Bug: 1519486

Change-Id: Id26c756d621a5352baaa25cc4f0fe531adf9838e

entry.title: privacy-hub: Add GoogleLocationServicesEnabled policy
entry.content:
Add GoogleLocationServicesEnabled user policy that's tied to the

`kUserGeolocationAccessLevel` pref. Admin will be able to force-set the

value of system geolocation setting to:

- Blocked

- Allowed

- Only allowed for system services

Or leave the policy unset to let users decide.



This policy will replace ArcGoogleLocationServicesEnabled policy and remove ARC hook for DefaultGeolocationSetting policy. These

will come in a follow-up CL.



Bug: b:298172164

Test: testing/xvfb.py out/Default/browser_tests --gtest_filter=*PrivacyHubPolicyTest*

entry.title: Sync cleanup: Make GetUpdatesCallerInfo.source optional
entry.content:
This used to be a required field, which however has been unused (and

filled with a dummy value) since at least 2018.

Marking it as optional is the next step towards fully removing it. (The

next step after that will be to stop populating it.)



No behavior change: For now, the client continues to always populate

the field.

entry.title: Reland "[wasm] Add wasm module caching for extensions with streaming instantiation"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 90af84e33ef48fadba3554f95d184808be6f0ea3.



Browsertest improvements:

- In the JS code of the extension, Wasm functions are called until all of them are optimised. In this change, once in a while we yield to the event loop by calling setTimeout().

- The flag "--wasm-tiering-budget" is set to 10 so that the optimised, TurboFan code is created right away.

- As it's not clear when the caching exactly happens, the test keeps opening new tabs (which triggers the execution of the JS code in the extension) and waiting until there is a cache hit. This makes the test more robust if the caching happens a bit later.

- Previously the test waited to see x hits and y misses after x+y loads of the extension. Now the test waits for x+y samples. This way we get an accurate error message if there is an issue and don't run into timeouts.

- Added logging for easier future debugging.



Original change's description:

> [wasm] Add wasm module caching for extensions with streaming

> instantiation

>

> Bug: v8:14518

> Change-Id: I896f85284d02feb089e095b8a925bd451bfee85e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5117546

> Reviewed-by: Finnur Thorarinsson

> Commit-Queue: Eva Herencsárová

> Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256324}

entry.title: [UPM] Add IsUsingProfileStore to the password edit dialog bridge
entry.content:
To correctly display the description message in the password edit

dialog, there is a need to know into which store the credential will be

saved or updated. Whenever the username is edited by the user, the

following checks will be done:

- Match the username among matching password forms. If there is one

matching, then the credential will be updated in the store when the

matching credential resides.

- If this is a new credential, then return true if there is no signed in

account or sync is off.



Bug: b/323859205

Change-Id: Ic79fb0aeebf387f66098f4c49c749141e1a6f23d

> >

> > This CL does the following:

> > - Disables cookie updates/OAuthMultiLogin when the user is not signed in

> > to chrome.

> > - In the above mode, accounts in the cookie are the source of truth.

> > Refresh tokens are updated to match the accounts in the cookie. If a

entry.title: Fix GetLacrosAvailability logic.
entry.content:
The original implementation has two issues.

- on kBeforeInit case, the policy is taken from the command line,

which is carried over from the previous session's primary user policy,

*even if the given user is not the corresponding user*.

- on kAfterInit case, the policy is taken from global cache,

which is for the primary user, *even if the given user is not

primary user*.



Fortunately, the function is used only by IsLacrosEnabledForMigration,

and there're no problematic behavior even if some wrong policy is

used.

Thus, this CL does not expect any production behavior change,

but just to fix the independent function behavior.



BUG=1494005

TEST=Tryjob. Manually check no crash on Lacros data migration.



Change-Id: I9c50905cd19d4aff1496b38ef9321f14efddf917

entry.title: Fix `SupervisionMixin`
entry.content:
`SupervisionMixin` uses the mix of `IdentityTestEnvironment` +

`FakeGaia`. This mix is tricky as `FakGaia` responds to /ListAccounts

request. It is intialized to use a default email and uses a fixed gaia

id.



The computation of the primary account without sync relies on both

Refresh tokens and cookies. While the `IdentityTestEnvironment` sets the

primary account, it doesn't set accounts in the cookie and uses a

generated gaia id.



The `SigninManager` upon setting the refresh token would try to update

the unconsented primary account.

`SigninManager::ComputeUnconsentedPrimaryAccountInfo` if cookie fresh,

will find that the first gaia account with the default gaia id "12345"

doesn't have a valid refresh token and therefore will clear the primary

account.



This behavior was hidden in test by the fact that the

- `IdentityTestUtils` sets the primary account first then the refresh

token.

- The first notification will trigger `OnPrimaryAccountUpdated`

- There is an early return in the `SigninManager` if this isn't about

clearing the primary account with sync consent.

- Some other code acts on the primary account change notification

- on refrehsh token update the primary account is removed.



Bug: b/320279580

Change-Id: Ie75389d495b61edc68f3d595f32a409f99d40f6a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5278183

Commit-Queue: Monica Basta

Reviewed-by: David Roger

Mega-CQ: Monica Basta

entry.title: [SWAutoPreload] Use MOJO_WRITE_DATA_FLAG_ALL_OR_NONE flag to write data
entry.content:
This is a fix for the crash happening in the write operation.

https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.magic_signature_1.name+LIKE+%27%25ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient%3A%3AReadAndWrite%25%27+AND+EXISTS+%28SELECT+1+FROM+UNNEST%28expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.experiments.ids%29+expanded_custom_data_ChromeCrashProto_experiments_ids+WHERE+expanded_custom_data_ChromeCrashProto_experiments_ids%3D%27e85106e5-4f4ac5b2%27%29#samplereports



Before this CL, we expected the same amount of data is written equally

into two data pipes. However, this assumption was wrong. Mojo

`WriteData()` can write data partially if the available buffer size is

not enough. If that happens, hits CHECK error.



After this CL, `WriteData()` will be called with the

|MOJO_WRITE_DATA_FLAG_ALL_OR_NONE| flag, which only write data if the

whole data can be written to the buffer. Along with this flag, this CL

limits input data not to exceed the write buffer limit. Otherwise it

causes the write operation would never be finished.



Bug: 40943349

Change-Id: I1055e479fe5e5b901bf5d4d8f8c4009fc8539ca6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5276561

entry.title: [URL] Disallow setting user/password/port for URLs with empty hosts
entry.content:
This CL aligns with the URL Standard by preventing the setting of

user, password, or port for URLs that don't permit them, specifically

when the host is null or empty.



This is a follow-up of the previous review:

https://crrev.com/c/5240153/15/third_party/blink/web_tests/platform/linux/virtual/url-non-special/external/wpt/url/url-setters.any.worker_exclude%3D(file_javascript_mailto)-expected.txt#20



Prior to this change:



> const url = "git:///";

> url.username = "x";

> url.href

"git://x@/"



After this change:



> const url = "git:///";

> url.username = "x";

> url.href

"git:///"



The URL Standard:

- https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#cannot-have-a-username-password-port



Username/password/port setters:

- https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-url-username

- https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-url-password

- https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-url-port



Since non-special URLs can now have a null or empty host, we should

consider a case where users set username/password/port for valid URLs

that have a null or empty host.



First, I attempted to update url::ReplaceComponents() so we can return

early, but GURL::ReplaceComponents() and KURL::ReplaceComponents() are

using url::ReplaceComponents() differently. I couldn't find a good

way.



Next, I considered updating both GURL::ReplaceComponents() and

KURL::ReplaceComponents() so they return early without calling

url::ReplaceComponents(), but redundancy was a concern.



After that, I realized that the best place to address this is the

canonicalization function for non-special URLs,

DoCanonicalizeNonSpecialURL(), as canonicalization occurs after URL

replacements, anyway. Implementing proper canonicalization should

effectively resolve the issue.



Bug: 40063064

Change-Id: Ibeb7f2dbaad196d83d26c8fb87bf47496bc989e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5276359

Reviewed-by: Timothy Gu

Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258381}

> Reland "Create D3D12 video decoder"

> > Create D3D12 video decoder

> >

> > Since the rendering side don't accept a D3D12Resource now, the d3d12

> > then let the D3D11Texture2D follow the current rendering pipeline.

entry.title: Undo/update some DanglingUntriaged added by crrev.com/c/5190661
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5190661 rewrote a bunch of pointers/references to

raw_ptr/ref, and naturally some needed DanglingUntriaged. However,

DanglingUntriaged also materialized in some pre-existing raw_ptrs,

which shouldn't really be needed. This CL undoes that.

entry.title: Move card unmask authentication selection to components/
entry.content:
In order to reuse the CardUnmaskAuthenticationSelectionControllerImpl on

iOS it must be moved out of chrome/.



CardUnmaskAuthenticationSelectionDialog::CreateAndShow() needs to be

injected since the implementations (for Desktop and Android) are

dependencies not allowed on iOS:



* chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/payments/card_unmask_authentication_selection_dialog_view.cc

* chrome/browser/ui/android/autofill/authenticator_selection_dialog_view_android.cc.



This change removes

CardUnmaskAuthenticationSelectionDialogControllerImpl's dependency on

WebContents since WebContents cannot be used on iOS. Additionally, the

preferred approach is for ChromeAutofillClient to own its dependencies

rather than putting them into the WebContentsUserData.



The dependency on vector_icons is removed to avoid including on iOS.



Bug: b:40282545, b:323571058

entry.title: Remove force-idle from Doze Mode production path
entry.content:
Force-idle helps only with the AC power cases, which are not a target

of Doze Mode v2. And the force-idle feature is mostly for testing,

so the code paths in Android don't get the frequent hardening or

maintenance of the regular DeviceIdle paths. So leaving force-idle

only for test scenarios.



When we reach the point of enabling Doze Mode for AC, we will

find another way to reach full idle while on AC power, which

does not depend on force-idle.



BUG=b:324374843

TEST=unit tests, manual tests on a real system

entry.title: fix: not call SetSerializedCachedMetadata when successful revalidation
entry.content:
When ScriptResource turns code_cache_with_hashing_supported on,

ScriptCachedMetadataHandler::Check and

ScriptCachedMetadataHandler::SetSerializedCachedMetadata would be

called and we have CHECK in SetSerializedCachedMetadata cause crash when

it happens after Check called: CHECK(hash_state_ != kChecked).



But when this resource cached by MemoryCache and have a successful

revalidation, now this crash would happens definitely in following

procedure:



-> request url and success response, we produce ScriptResource instance

-> SetSerializedCachedMetadata and Check happens normally

-> request this url again, and hit MemoryCache in ResourceFetcher, we

reuse this ScriptResource instance

-> script Revalidate - Success - ResponseReceived

-> SetSerializedCachedMetadata --- Crash Happens!



Bug: 1523902

Change-Id: I0b85ec35c3b6f86d242fb7cc9d660f36be57d718

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5256540

Reviewed-by: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Commit-Queue: Hiroki Nakagawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258357}

entry.title: media: Disable hardware secure decryption for software emulated GPUs
entry.content:
Disabled hardware secure decryption for software emulated GPUs because

users may have poor playback experience by the high chance of error

with the following vendor IDs:

- 0x0000: Unknown (failed to collect the GPU ID information)

- 0xffff: Software rasterizers (internal use)

- 0x15ad: VMware

- 0x1414: Microsoft software renderer



By disabling the hardware secure decryption for these devices, we

expect to see some benefits:

- Improve the success rate (with slightly losing the device coverage)

- Avoid unnecessary investigation time on the reported issues caused by

these supported devices



To override if the system is affected/disabled by this change,

- Use `--disable_media_foundation_hardware_security=0` flag

- Alternatively, use `--override-hardware-secure-codecs-for-testing`

flag



Added and tested a new unit test for the software emulation scenario.

```

autoninja -C out/Default content_unittests

.\out\Default\content_unittests --gtest_filter=CdmRegistryImplTest.KeySystemCapabilities_* --single-process-tests --use-gpu-in-tests

```



Tested locally with and without including my test device in the

disabling list. Also verified passing

`--disable_media_foundation_hardware_security=0` flag neutralized

the GPU bug workaround feature when disabled.



For details, see http://shortn/_F92jGaDn2l



Bug: 41496376, 41497095, b/315852895, b/302384163

Change-Id: I8ae4284d7de389ade9fac89ef3f20c5a2581ca9d

entry.content:

the upload flow wasn't exited early (TaskResult was

kCancelledAtConfirmation or kFileAlreadyBeingUploaded). If the upload

flow wasn't exited early, the UploadResult is expected to be logged

regardless of the state of TaskResult. Make sure this logic persists in

the tests.

entry.title: [ozone] Add zaura_output_manager_v2 client side impl
entry.content:
This CL introduces WaylandZAuraOutputManagerV2, serving as the

client-side handle for the zaura_output_manager_v2 global.



This class handles output configuration change events, communicated

to clients via the following events.

wl_registry.global - output adds

wl_registry.global_remove - output removes

zaura_output_manager_v2.* - output changes

zaura_output_manager_v2.done - transaction complete



This global must be advertised by the server before other output

globals. If this is bound clients will skip binding to older

output extensions (zaura_outut_manager, zxdg_output_manager_v1).



The zaura_output_manager_v2 global is enabled for ozone tests

generally under the AuraOutputManagerProtocol::kEnabledV2 enum.



TestZAuraOutputManagerV2 has been introduced to integrate the

protocol with the ozone/wayland test suites, enabled under the

AuraOutputManagerProtocol::kEnabledV2 enum flag.



Bug: 40063732, 40062713, 41491312, 324111902

Change-Id: Ib29580ab6ca5a8eeae3efce829b9ee8fd47ec5da

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5265858

entry.title: sensors: Only skip Sensor::Deactivate() from ContextDestroyed() if idle
entry.content:
The code also skipped Deactivate() if |pending_error_notification_| was

active, but there is a short window during which ContextDestroyed() may

be called between HandleError() and NotifyError() that would cause the

latter to hit its DCHECK for |state_|.



Relax the ContextDestroyed() check so that Deactivate() is skipped only

if |state_| is idle.



Fixed: 324301018

Change-Id: I796bf74c34ff8d69109be34a30141eb38d365b64

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272614
